section.title: Demonstration 1 Main Page

content.text: This demonstration covers a more complex fixed asset referencing example. It covers a non-recurring purchase order (PJ) with two different (R-type) projects that also reference two different real property (R-type projects) asset records. Thus, two different asset records are referenced by two different purchase order accounting lines It demonstrates the following key concepts: How to reference multiple real property fixed assets from multiple header accounting lines on a purchase order How to create multiple asset record lines How to link asset accounting records to ensure they match up to the purchase order header accounting lines.
Demonstration 3 | Purchase Order with Multiple Header Accounting Lines to Multiple Asset Records
Pegasys Fixed Assets

content.text: This is the Header page for our Order (PJ).
Let's take a look at the Header Accounting Lines.
The Header Accounting Lines page appears. It has two lines, each with different R-type projects.
Select the Header link
Click the Fixed Assets tab so we can reference Asset Numbers.
The Fixed Assets page appears
Click the Add button
On this first fixed asset line, we'll reference asset number RPA00113PA0158ZZ
The Asset Type is IMPROVMNT.
The Betterment Number is 0 since it is a new asset.
Select the Accounting Lines tab so we can choose which Header Accounting Line goes with this asset.
Click the Add button
The Accounting Line page appears
We will reference Header Accounting Line 1 for $100,000. That's the full amount of the that line.
Select the top Fixed Assets link to display our new fixed asset line and to add another.
Click the Add button
Now we have a second fixed asset line. Let's reference an asset number to go with our second Header Accounting Line.
Select the Accounting Lines tab to reference Header Accounting Line 2 on the second fixed asset.
Click the Add button
The Accounting Line page appears
Click the top Fixed Assets link.
The Fixed Assets page now shows the two assets we referenced.
Click the Save button
Then click the Verify button.
If there are no errors, click the Submit button.
